title: Ticket #2896: condor_status -format may fail if an expression is used
description:
On condor-users, a user reports the following command used to work but no longer does: 

condor_status -f "%s " 'regexps("<([^:]+):\d+>", MyAddress, "\1")'

However, another user reported this very similar command works: 

condor_status -f " " MyAddress -f "%s \n" 'regexps("<([^:]+):\d+>", MyAddress, "\1")'

I think there is a bug preventing the first version of the command from working. Specifically, I am guessing that the bug stems from #408 and the following code in /src/condor_status.V6/status.cpp : 

...
if (matchPrefix (argv[i], "-format", 2)) {
	pm.registerFormat (argv[i+1], argv[i+2]);
	projList.AppendArg(argv[i+2]);
...

Instead of just inserting argv[i+2] into the projList, I think argv[i+2] needs to be parsed as a classad expression and any externally unresolved attributes need to be inserted.

The only bewildering part about all this is in the original report the user says it all used to work in Condor v7.4.2, and #408 was supposedly merged in v7.3.
